intro: Maytenus itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is native to Brazil, specifically the state of Rio de Janeiro, where it grows in humid tropical forests. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
